channel.title: Server notice troubles [PI]

item.title: Server notice troubles [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Ruby Forums Coder, post:6, topic:435352”][quote author=TormentedSoul link=topic=538070.msg3935877#msg3935877 date=1331054150]
Haha your turn to help me. How much rep does a person get if someone clicks the rep++ and how many times can you click it and do you loose rep if you rep someone?
[/quote]

You can choose how much rep to give them, I think the limit is like 20 you can give :). And no, you don’t lose rep haha :).[/quote]incorrect. the amount of rep given is totally dependent on your current rep. For example, the max rep a person can give @ 200 rep is 13 rep. A person with 180 rep may be able to give 12 rep and vise versa.

Read full topic

item.title: Server notice troubles [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

TormentedSoul:

Haha your turn to help me. How much rep does a person get if someone clicks the rep++ and how many times can you click it and do you loose rep if you rep someone?

You can choose how much rep to give them, I think the limit is like 20 you can give :). And no, you don’t lose rep haha :).

item.title: Server notice troubles [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“TormentedSoul, post:3, topic:435352”]I know the problem take a look at this code here.

public void mymessage() { EventManager.getSingleton().addEvent(new Event() { public void execute(EventContainer c) { int r3 = 0; r3 = Misc.random(4); if (r3 == 0) { sendMessage("<shad=255>[News]: Website at http://sardonia.webs.com"); } else if (r3 == 1) { sendMessage("<shad=255>[News]: Donaters have great benefits. Read forums for more"); } else if (r3 == 2) { sendMessage("<shad=255>[News]: Nex has just been added with maps type ::nex"); } else if (r3 == 3) { sendMessage("<shad=255>[News]: For help type ::help a member of staff will assist you"); } else if (r3 == 4) { sendMessage("<shad=255>[News]: More updates to come. Game is still underway."); } } }, 200000); //milisecondsservermessage

You need to set a int to read the messages. such as

int r3 = 0; r3 = Misc.random(4); if (r3 == 0) {

Change that to whatever you want. If you do not set an int to read the code then it will just read of the first code because the other properties are not set.[/quote]

Ahaaa! thank you! I thought it had something to do with an int, but like I said, I’m relatively new so I thought it better to ask.

Thanks a bunch, rep++ :).

Read full topic

item.title: Server notice troubles [PI]
item.dc:creator: @TormentedSoul TormentedSoul
item.description:
@TormentedSoul wrote:

I know the problem take a look at this code here.

public void mymessage() { EventManager.getSingleton().addEvent(new Event() { public void execute(EventContainer c) { int r3 = 0; r3 = Misc.random(4); if (r3 == 0) { sendMessage("<shad=255>[News]: Website at http://sardonia.webs.com"); } else if (r3 == 1) { sendMessage("<shad=255>[News]: Donaters have great benefits. Read forums for more"); } else if (r3 == 2) { sendMessage("<shad=255>[News]: Nex has just been added with maps type ::nex"); } else if (r3 == 3) { sendMessage("<shad=255>[News]: For help type ::help a member of staff will assist you"); } else if (r3 == 4) { sendMessage("<shad=255>[News]: More updates to come. Game is still underway."); } } }, 200000); //milisecondsservermessage

You need to set a int to read the messages. such as

int r3 = 0; r3 = Misc.random(4); if (r3 == 0) {

Change that to whatever you want. If you do not set an int to read the code then it will just read of the first code because the other properties are not set.

Read full topic

item.title: Server notice troubles [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Hey, I’m relatively new to java, I’ve made rsps websites and vote4cash scripts and such, but I’ve never actually gotten round to programming a source. I’ve mainly been following tutorials but I can’t find a tutorial for this.

I’ve added this

public void initialize() {
	        mymessage();
		//mymessage();

This works for sending one server message, but I can’t get it to send random ones.
Here’s what I’ve got so far:

	public void mymessage() {
        EventManager.getSingleton().addEvent(new Event() {
            public void execute(EventContainer c) {
                sendMessage("[@gre@Did you know?@bla@]: You can do ::vote to vote for 10m!");
            }
			{
                sendMessage("[@gre@Did you know?@bla@]: Our source can theoretically hold 400 players with no lag!");
            }
			{
                sendMessage("[@gre@Did you know?@bla@]: You can do ::donatenow and it'll take you straight to our donate page.");
            }
			{
                sendMessage("[@gre@Did you know?@bla@]: Our forums are the heart of our server, join now! http://prothieum.org/forums/");
            }
			{
                sendMessage("[@gre@Did you know?@bla@]: Our development team work for hours every day to make us the best there is.");
            }
        }, 50000); //Time it takes to send the message

When I launch the source and I go onto the beta client it only sends the first message, can someone help me out here?

Thanks in advance,
Ruby.

Read full topic
